msbt.message: Did you know that just about every form of life that lived during the Paleozoic era is extinct? That's 300 million years of history, and all we have left are a few bones.That's why I always say "carpe diem," you know? It's Italian for "relax and have a milkshake."
Can you believe that all of these wild ancient creatures basically evolved into what we are today? It's true! I have a little bit of velociraptor on my mother's side of the family.
These ancient bones survived millions of years just to see you, . All I had to do was walk a few feet. Advantage, !
The very last dinosaurs went extinct about 65 million years ago. But what if they hadn't? Would my favorite barista be a brontosaurus? Probably!
Live well and leave a beautiful fossil, isn't that how the saying goes?I plan to strike an incredible pose in my last moments to surprise the person who digs me up. LikeTHIS!
Whoa! Can you hear the ghosts of the dinosaurs breathing? Hufffffhuffff Wait. That's just me breathing.<10_4 /> False alarm, everyone!
Ugh, these fossils get to show off their best side for all of eternity. I'm jealous!
I wonder if my skeleton will be on display like this in a million years or so Guess I'd better keep up a good calcium routine if I want these bones to really sparkle!
I wonder what these creatures looked like in their full glory.Were they the dinosaur equivalent of beauty pageant winners?
Aha! I see you're a fellow connoisseur of the prehistoric.Let's bump fists and imagine that it's two skeletons fist-bumping!
I bet it gets pretty lonely and creepy in here when no one's aroundThen again, no one would be here to witness it except these old bones. Socreep on, skeletons!
Any of these old skeletons catch your eye, ?What do you mean, what for? I'm just asking if you like the skeletons, OK? It's a normal question!
I'm glad we have a place to keep all of the vintage bones that are being dug up. Some of these things are TRÈS chic. That's Jurassic for "super retro."

I just came by to look at some cool bones and maybe get inspired for my next line of faux-bone jewelry, but This place is actually blowing my mind! It's like I've traveled back in time to the dinosaur ages
You know, a museum of this caliber is on my list of Top Ten Island Must-Haves.Didn't think I'd be into fossils, huh? C'mon—they're, like, the definition of classic! Ha HA!
